LanguageData.TKUtils.NameQueueTooltips.Remove: Click to remove this viewer from the name queue
LanguageData.TKUtils.ItemTableTooltips.ToStackLimit: Set this item's quantity limit to the item's stack limit.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ItemTableTooltips.EditItemName: Customize the name of this item.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ItemTableTooltips.ResetItemName: Reset the item's name to its default value.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ItemTableTooltips.ResetItemKarma: Reset the item's karma type to its default value.
LanguageData.TKUtils.TraitTableTooltips.EditTraitName: Customize the name of this trait.
LanguageData.TKUtils.TraitTableTooltips.ResetTraitNam: Reset the trait's name to its default value.
LanguageData.TKUtils.TraitTableTooltips.ResetTraitKar: Reset the trait's karma type to its default value.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EventTableTooltips.EditEventName: Customize the purchase code of this event.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EventTableTooltips.ResetEventNam: Reset the event's purchase code to its default value.
LanguageData.TKUtils.SelectorTooltips.ExcludeItem: Click to make this selector exclude results containing this text.
LanguageData.TKUtils.SelectorTooltips.IncludeItem: Click to make this selector include results containing this text.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MutatorTooltips.StackMode: Click to make this mutator mutate all results to a fixed value.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MutatorTooltips.ValueMode: Click to make this mutator mutate all results to their stack limit.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MutatorTooltips.PercentPrice: Click to make this mutator mutate all results to a fixed value.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MutatorTooltips.ValuePrice: Click to make this mutator mutate all results with a percentage of its current value.
LanguageData.TKUtils.PartialTooltips.LoadPartial: Click to load the data within this partial.
LanguageData.TKUtils.EditorTooltips.GetHelp: Opens your browser to the help pages for the editor.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CommandEditorTooltips.Tags: Opens your browser to a list of placeholders you can use in custom commands.
LanguageData.TKUtils.MainTabTooltips.Report: Reported by {0} {1} ago.\n\nClick to copy stacktrace.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.ChannelField: This field stores the channel the bot will connect to on Twitch.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.BotUsernameField: This field stores the username the bot will use to connect to your channel with. If the account the token was generated for does not match the text in this field, the account the token is for will be used instead.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.TokenField: This field stores the token used by the mod's bot to connect to your channel on Twitch. If you do not have a token, or otherwise lost it, you can click the relevant button to the right to create a new one.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.ToggleTokenVisible: When clicked, the text inside the "token" text field will be changed so it's masked with asterisks.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.ToggleTokenHidden: When clicked, the text inside the "token" text field will be changed so the actual token is visible instead of asterisks.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.SameAsChannel: When clicked, the text inside of the "channel" text field will be copied into this field.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.NewToken: Opens your browser to a 3rd party website for generating a chat token.\n\nNote: The token generated will be for the account you are currently logged into on Twitch. If you wanted to use a different account for your bot, you must log into it before making the token.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.AutoConnect: When enabled, the mod's bot will automatically connect to your channel when the game starts up. If this is disabled, you will have to manually connect the bot through this menu, or through the addon menu.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.AllowWhispers: When enabled, viewers can whisper commands to the mod's bot on Twitch instead of sending them in chat.\n\nNote: This does not disable comands in chat. It only allows viewers to whisper the bot.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.ForcedWhispers: When enabled, viewers must whisper commands to the mod's bot on Twitch in order to use commands.\n\nNote: If this setting is enabled and whispers are disabled, the mod will not process any commands. You must have whispers enabled to use this setting.
LanguageData.TKUtils.CoreTooltips.SendMessage: When enabled, the mod will send a "Connected!" message in chat when it connects to your channel on Twitch.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ViewerTooltips.UnmodViewer: When clicked, {0} will be removed from the list of Toolkit moderators.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ViewerTooltips.ModViewer: When clicked, {0} will be added to the list of Toolkit moderators. Toolkit moderators are granted access to mod only commands, like giving coins.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ViewerTooltips.UnbanViewer: When clicked, {0} will be removed from the list of banned viewers.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ViewerTooltips.BanViewer: When clicked, {0} will be added to the list of banned viewers.
LanguageData.TKUtils.ViewerTooltips.ResetViewer: When clicked, the data for {0} will be reset to the starting values you've set in Twitch Toolkit's settings.
